p: Although reviews on preterm birth and heat published prior to this project’s scoping phase suggested that the association was unclear [ 82, 83], several studies have been published more recently indicating an association between birth outcomes and heat [ 84– 94]. Future burden of disease assessments in Michigan should consider birth outcomes, particularly in light of the high baseline preterm birth rate in Detroit [ 95]. Similarly, we did not identify injuries, including occupational injury not listed as heat-related, or self-inflicted injuries as EH-associated concerns in the scoping phase. Recent research indicates significant associations of non-heat-related injuries with EH [ 96, 97], and future Michigan climate burden of disease assessments should consider EH-associated injuries.
